config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The iosCreateImagesetFolders configuration option is used to determine whether to create an imageset folder for iOS or not. If the option is enabled, a new folder with the target image file name suffixed with '.imageset' is created inside the destination folder. If the option is disabled, a default root folder is created instead.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The iosCreateImagesetFolders configuration is triggered multiple times during the execution of the program. It is triggered when creating the main subfolder, during pre-execution tasks, and during the clean-up process.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the iosCreateImagesetFolders configuration option is significant as it determines the folder structure for iOS images. Enabling the option results in the creation of specific imageset folders, while disabling it leads to a different folder structure being used. This can affect the organization and accessibility of image resources within the system.
